title: How to Make an Origami Flapping Bird with Paper

steps.title: Get a square piece of paper.
steps.content: Get a square piece of paper . To make your own square paper: fold one corner of a sheet of rectangular paper diagonally to form a triangle; then, cut the excess paper away. You can use any size paper, but origami paper and A4 paper are the best.

steps.title: Fold a large X into the paper.
steps.content: Fold a large X into the paper. If you haven’t already, fold the square in half diagonally. Repeat in the other direction. Unfold the paper and you should see the X. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the paper over.
steps.content: Turn the paper over. Make sure the ever-so-slightly-raised center of the X points up (like the top of a very flat pyramid). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold a large + into the paper.
steps.content: Fold a large + into the paper. First both vertically and horizontally to form a + that intersects with the center of the X. When you’re done, the creases of the + will bend in the opposite direction as those of the X. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Bring all of the corners in toward the center.
steps.content: Bring all of the corners in toward the center. The shape is similar to the origami “fortune teller” (a.k.a. “ cootie catcher ”) used in children’s games. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Flatten the paper into a square.
steps.content: Flatten the paper into a square. Turn the paper, so that you have a diamond with the open end facing you. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the top edges of the diamond inwards toward the center line.
steps.content: Fold the top edges of the diamond inwards toward the center line. Start by making sure the opening is at the top of the diamond. [6] X Research source Grab the right-hand corner of the upper layer and fold it downwards and inwards toward the center, then repeat on the left-hand side. Flip the paper over and repeat on the other layer.

steps.title: Gently unfold all the folds you made in Step 7.
steps.content: Gently unfold all the folds you made in Step 7. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pull up the bottom corner of the diamond, opening it up.
steps.content: Pull up the bottom corner of the diamond, opening it up. Flatten. Turn the paper over and repeat. You should end up with a kite shape. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Hold your new diamond shape with the split end up and fold each of the top points so that they point downward and outward to the sides.
steps.content: Hold your new diamond shape with the split end up and fold each of the top points so that they point downward and outward to the sides.

steps.title: Fold the remaining layers of the kite downwards (front and back).
steps.content: Fold the remaining layers of the kite downwards (front and back). [9] X Research source

steps.title: Take one of the side points formed in step 10 and pinch the tip to form the head.
steps.content: Take one of the side points formed in step 10 and pinch the tip to form the head. Pull it down slightly, reverse its crease, and bend it downwards. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Round the wings.
steps.content: Round the wings. Pull them outwards away from the body and round them with your hands.

steps.title: Make your bird flap.
steps.content: Make your bird flap. Pinch and pull the bird by the neck and tail. [11] X Research source
